snippet: As Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair awaits trial on charges of sexual assault, lawmakers are expected to debate a bill to strip commanders of prosecuting decisions.
abstract: Proceedings in court-martial of Brig Gen Jeffrey A Sinclair on sexual assault charges are likely to provide fodder for both sides of congressional debate on a far-reaching rewrite of military law that would strip commanders of the power to decide which allegations of sexual assault and other serious crimes go to trial.
lead_paragraph: As Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair awaits trial on charges of sexual assault, lawmakers are expected to debate a bill to strip commanders of prosecuting decisions.

headline.main: Military Sex Assault Trial Showcases 2 Approaches to Prosecution
headline.print_headline: Military Sex Assault Trial Showcases 2 Approaches to Prosecution

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
